intro: Ormerodia linearilobata, commonly known as the narrow-lobed ormerodia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Ormerodia linearilobata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
